client.view

Class Texture

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.view.Texture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Animation

    public class Texture
extends java.lang.Object
    The Texture object should always be used if an asset is used multiple times to make sure it is not initialized more than necessary.
    Author:
    Steven Bronsveld

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap()
      returns the bitmap of this texture.
      android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap(int offset)
      Returns the bitmap of this texture with any animation offset applied to it.
      int getHeight() 
      java.lang.String getName() 
      static Texture getTexture(java.lang.String name)
      Gets a texture from the database, if it isn't yet in the database it is constructed
      int getWidth() 
      static boolean hasTexture(java.lang.String name)
      Check if the texture is loaded before
      static void init(android.content.res.AssetManager manager)
      Initializes the texture class, needs to be called before the game needs to display textures

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.content.res.AssetManager manager)
        Initializes the texture class, needs to be called before the game needs to display textures

      • hasTexture

        public static boolean hasTexture(java.lang.String name)
        Check if the texture is loaded before
        Parameters:
        name - The name (path) of the texture
        Returns:
        Whether the texture already exists

      • getTexture

        public static Texture getTexture(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a texture from the database, if it isn't yet in the database it is constructed
        Parameters:
        name - The name (path) of the texture

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the texture

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        The height of the texture

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        The name (path) of the texture

      • getBitmap

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap()
        returns the bitmap of this texture. If the current texture is an animation it chooses the correct frame based on the system time.
        Returns:
        The bitmap of the texture. If the texture is used at more places the same bitmap will be returned.

      • getBitmap

        public android.graphics.Bitmap getBitmap(int offset)
        Returns the bitmap of this texture with any animation offset applied to it.
        Parameters:
        offset - The number of frames the returned bitmap is.
        Returns:
        The bitmap of the texture.
        See Also:
        getBitmap()
